data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of null
data.body:
**Atom**: 1.19.0-beta2 x64
**Electron**: 1.6.9
**OS**: "CentOS Linux
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of null

```
At /usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:2138

TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of null
    at horizontalPositionsToMeasure.forEach (/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:2138:73)
    at Map.forEach (native)
    at TextEditorComponent.measureHorizontalPositions (/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:2134:45)
    at TextEditorComponent.measureContentDuringUpdateSync (/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:378:16)
    at scheduler.readDocument (/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:263:20)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.performDocumentUpdate (/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/view-registry.js:191:15)
    at /usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/src/view-registry.js:3:65
```

### Commands

```
 50x -3:48.9.0 core:undo (input.hidden-input)
 28x -3:45.7.0 core:move-up (input.hidden-input)
     -3:38.1.0 core:save (input.hidden-input)
  2x -0:25.1.0 core:backspace (input.hidden-input)
  8x -0:24.3.0 core:page-up (input.hidden-input)
     -0:22.5.0 core:page-down (input.hidden-input)
  2x -0:22 core:move-left (input.hidden-input)
     -0:21.6.0 core:backspace (input.hidden-input)
     -0:21.2.0 editor:move-to-end-of-screen-line (input.hidden-input)
     -0:20.9.0 editor:newline (input.hidden-input)
     -0:19.1.0 core:select-all (input.hidden-input)
     -0:18.7.0 core:copy (input.hidden-input)
     -0:17.6.0 core:paste (input.hidden-input)
     -0:14.9.0 core:undo (input.hidden-input)
     -0:04.2.0 editor:consolidate-selections (input.hidden-input)
     -0:04.2.0 core:cancel (input.hidden-input)
```

data.title: copy multiple directories from left side project pane with Shift/Ctrl shortcut not work
data.body:
### Steps to Reproduce

- select some directories from left side project pane using Shift/Ctrl shortcut
- then using right-click menu bar select "copy"
- select other directory and then using right-click menu bar select "paste"

**Expected behavior:**
We hope all the directories should be copied to the target directory.

**Actual behavior:**
Only part or single director was copied to the target directory.


### Versions
```
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```

data.title: Uncaught RangeError: Invalid array length
data.body:
Steps from @WestFlame https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15111#issuecomment-320360333
1. In Settings, editor section, set Line Height to 0. And after second, this exception appears.
2. Then if I change the number to anything sane (1.0 and above), there are still new exceptions appearing (the same ones).

data.title: Disable: remove trailing whitespace on save
data.body:
Atom has manged my diff by removing some other developers trailing spaces.  I'm unable to find this setting to disable it:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/204121/28687377-cdccb6e8-72d3-11e7-84ec-ae1dfdb84daa.png)

I'm using 1.14.2 .. This stack overflow says Adom is trying to stick with a posix standard, I'm just giving you a quick reminder that that is a real headache and this setting is very hard to find to disable.

 I have had to stop working for 1/2 an hour now over this...  Other than that, Adam has saved me hours and hours of time so thanks for the awesome editor.  I just hope you can make things like this a bit less invasive (on large files) and easier to find (Make the word Package and Settings consistent for example)..

data.title: Disable:
data.body:

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

[Description of the issue]

### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

### Versions

You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Remove duplicate mocking
data.body:
Prior to this PR, we were mocking `Date.now` once in the spec helper, then blowing up with a redundant mock error when `jasmine.useMockClock` is called.

Since this was newly introduced, let's only set it up when clock mocking is specifically requested to minimize breakage. We really need to deprecate the global spec helper someday. It's bad news.

This needs to be hot-fixed to 1.19.

/cc @hansonw

data.title: Scrollbar appears to disappear/reappear when editor window is resized
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Scrollbar appears to disappear and reappear when the editor window is resized. I may open a file and the scrollbar is initially visible, but it will eventually disappear. From that state, changing the height of the scrollbar content (opening find-and-replace, resize window, etc) will cause the scrollbar to toggle between visible and invisible. From the inspector, the vertical-scrollbar and scrollbar-content don't seem to change other than the "height: ###px" of the scrollbar-content element changing. Manually changing the height in the style of the element also flips it's visibility on/off. It can even occur while scrolling with the mouse.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Generate a large file, I used: `python -c '[print((n,)*50) for n in range(1000)]' > f`
2. Open the file with atom, using angle: `electron --app=/usr/lib/atom --use-gl=angle ./f` (I'm using angle because of this virtualbox issue: [Virtualbox 15417](https://www.virtualbox.org/ticket/15417), without it, atom causes the desktop to lock up. `--disable-gpu` has the same effect as far as this issue is concerned.) 
3. Observe the scrollbar disappear while resizing editor pane, triggered by scrolling, resizing window, opening/closing find-and-replace panel, etc.

**Expected behavior:** The scrollbar appears on the side of the editor and never disappears under any resize.

**Actual behavior:** Scrollbar disappears and reappears when editor is resized.

**Reproduces how often:** Inconsistently. I'm able to reproduce it every time by opening a the file like above. However, it does not always trigger on opening a new file from within atom.


### Versions

Platform: Arch Linux, up-to-date as of 26/7/2017
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.4.16
Chrome  : 53.0.2785.143
Node    : 6.5.0
apm  1.18.3
npm  5.3.0
node 8.2.1 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.13.3

### Additional Information

If a second file is opened in atom, this scrollbar issue is observed independently. The issue appears to be specific to a file's window/tab and having the issue observed for one file's window/tab doesn't seem to have any impact on whether or not it will be observed when switching focus to another file. Closing and re-opening a file may temporarily alleviate the issue but switching context between files does not.

data.title: PHP instanceof word
data.body: First of all it is not an issue. Just basic a question. `Instanceof` word isn't highlighted. What should I do?

data.title: Drag and open the project in same window
data.body:
I really like the feature of dragging the file and dropping inside the ATOM text editor to open as a project in new Window.

Is there is any way to turn that function off to open in new Window, I want that the open drag and drop should open in the same window.

data.title: Two icons in taskbar (Windows)
data.body:
I am not sure if other people face the same issue or not.
When I launch the atom it shows two icons.

Here is the image:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29014463/28673747-008a5df6-7301-11e7-9d7a-cf03672fcc76.png)

data.title: The editor has crashed - Please help.
data.body:
I'm using linux elementary distribution.
atom was working good but recently when I open atom I've the error

> The editor has crashed
> Please report this issue to https://github.com/atom/atom
> Close window | Reload | keep it open

I tried to reinstall and I still have the same problem atom can't start and the same error appears
how to fix it??

data.title: Uncaught Error: Cannot find module './commands/edit-line'
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce:]

1. open new buffer
2. type `"foo"`
3. place cursor inside string and attempt to activate "toggle quotes"

**Atom**: 1.18.0 x64
**Electron**: 1.3.15
**OS**: Mac OS X 10.12.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Cannot find module './commands/edit-line'

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/<embedded>:1

Error: Cannot find module './commands/edit-line'
    at Module._resolveFilename (module.js:455:15)
    at Module._resolveFilename (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/electron.asar/common/reset-search-paths.js:35:12)
    at Function.get_Module._resolveFilename (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/module-cache.js:354:58)
    at Module.require (Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.js:40:43)
    at require (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/native-compile-cache.js:66:33)
    at /packages/markdown-writer/lib/markdown-writer.coffee:132:28)
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/command-registry.js:265:35)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/command-registry.js:3:65
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.dispatchCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:610:22)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:401:28)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentKeyEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:100:42)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:3:65)
```

### Commands

```
     -2:05.4.0 settings-view:open (input.hidden-input)
```

data.title: Add Workspace Items optional methods to documentation
data.body:
### Description

The [Workspace documentation](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.18.0/Workspace) lists a workspace item's [required methods](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.18.0/Workspace#required-methods) but does not list the [optional methods](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/workspace.js#L45) listed in the comments of /src/workspace.js.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97994/28640784-6a8cbb4e-7212-11e7-8c7f-ff92596a51e7.png)

data.title: Persist undo history when reopening a previously-closed buffer
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Undo/redo don't work after the file has been closed.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open existing file (or create the new one)
2. Edit this file
3. Close this file
4. Restore the last closed tab (`Ctrl+Shift+T`)
5. Undo/redo don't work!

**Expected behavior:** Undo/redo work after reopening closed file.

**Actual behavior:** Undo/redo don't work after reopening closed file.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 3.6.2
git 2.13.3

$ uname -a
Linux Alex-ArchMainPC 4.11.9-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Jul 5 18:23:08 CEST 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

### Additional Information

Missing.

data.title: Comment blocks indentation changes incorrectly on move line up/down command
data.body:
When you have a standard code comment block like this:
```
/**
 * Some comment
 */

```
and then use the move line up/down command (CTRL + UP for me), it re-indents the lines but not correctly as it displays like this: 
```
/**
* Some comment
*/

```

I know this is a really small issue but it would be really nice if it could be fixed.

I'm using ATOM 1.19.05 beta on Windows 10

data.title: Atom hangs indefinitely when executing a regex search and replace on a large file
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When doing a regex search and replace editor hangs for a long period of time

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Load a large text file ( I tested with one that's 180 MB, 365'542 lines )
2. Search and replace using a regex

**Expected behavior:** Some progress bar and not to hang prompting a message "Atom is taking a long time, do you want to close it or wait"

**Actual behavior:** hangs for an indefinite amount of time, sometimes 1 minute, sometimes 10 minutes not showing any progress

**Reproduces how often:** Everytime i do a regex search on a large file

### Versions

Atom version 1.18 and 1.19.0-beta5 tested.
Windows 10, latest update.
Intel core i7 6700HQ
16 GB RAM

data.title: Define indent/outdent behavior for single-line selected text
data.body:
Coming from atom/snippets#239, I have now realized that there isn't a properly defined behavior for selecting text on single line and indenting/outdenting it:

![indent_undefined_behavior](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1017132/28606639-b0d2367e-71e0-11e7-90cb-35bc9ce09c3c.gif)

Here is why I don't think this has been defined yet:
1. There is no spec for single-line selected text being indented via `indent()`: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a7736b81e3f6628f2a9e685f28f4c1df9a5e4615/spec/text-editor-spec.coffee#L3673-L3789

2. `indentSelectedRows` (which is used in `indent()`) is poorly documented:
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a7736b81e3f6628f2a9e685f28f4c1df9a5e4615/src/selection.coffee#L671-L679
    > If the selection spans multiple rows, indent all of them.

    It's possible to interpret this in a way that if the selection does not span across multiple rows, then nothing gets indented. [_Insert your favorite programmer-goes-to-grocery-store-joke here._](https://www.reddit.com/r/Jokes/comments/1nmkfq/a_programmer_is_going_to_the_grocery_store/)

3. The current behavior is not intuitive and unexpected for anyone coming from a different editor. With the exception of Brackets, other text editors tend to agree that selecting text and pressing tab within a single line should not indent the whole line, but insert/overwrite with a tab.

Outdent is done through `outdentSelectedRows`, which [has a spec for single line selected text](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/2420d12e44f33f0178c8c0ef41e3a2c22cf4fb8e/spec/text-editor-spec.coffee#L4265-L4270). However it seems to be slightly mislabeled, there is actually less than one line selected. That is not a big deal and can be easily fixed, but it's possible that something is missing from here too.

At minimum I am looking to define behavior for following cases:
1. Selecting whole line and issuing `indent()`.
2. Selecting substring within line with length greater than 0 and issuing `indent()`.
3. Selecting whole line and issuing `outdentSelectedRows()`.
4. Selecting substring within line with length greater than 0 and issuing `outdentSelectedRows()`.

There might be additional cases that might need be considered, but I don't want this to be come overly ambitious, so starting with a more managable goal might be better.

The motivation for all of this comes from behavior related to text selections that come from traversing tab stops within snippets, where indenting/outdenting may lead to unexpected results:

![indent_snippet1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1017132/28608860-e7ee5908-71ea-11e7-8bc2-19aadfcc2a3b.gif)
![indent_snippet2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1017132/28608859-e7edd960-71ea-11e7-90d3-7b1bfb94e899.gif)

Personally I think that outdent behavior can be kept as-is and it is sufficient to simply improve the spec and cover cases 3 and 4. Outdenting does not break out of snippet's tab stops whereas indenting does, so indicating change with a slightly more destructive (but predictable) operation should be obvious enough that it's impossible to return to snippet's tab stops.

Visual Studio Code's behavior is a suitable candidate, which indents if the whole line is selected, but inserts a tab when only part of line is selected. Outdent is handled in the same way as Atom does it now. If there aren't any objections or better ideas, I might just implement that and propose this as the final solution.

Code at the time of writing in pull request is just to get the ball rolling and does not represent the final proposed solution in any way. But it does replace everything with a tab if at most only one line has been selected.

data.title: Error: Cannot find module '/Users/Username/Desktop/spec' - on clean installation
data.body:
### Description

I've got an error message after running `apm test` in console:

```
[5973:0725/203751:INFO:CONSOLE(105)] "Error: Cannot find module '/Users/Username/Desktop/spec'
  at Module._resolveFilename (module.js:455:15)
  at Module._resolveFilename (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/electron.asar/common/reset-search-paths.js:35:12)
  at Function.Module._resolveFilename (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/module-cache.js:350:52)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:403:25)
  at Module.require (module.js:483:17)
  at require (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/native-compile-cache.js:47:27)
  at requireSpecs (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/jasmine-test-runner.js:99:7)
  at module.exports (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/spec/jasmine-test-runner.js:47:7)
  at module.exports (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/initialize-test-window.js:89:17)
  at setupWindow (file:///Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.js:106:12)
  at window.onload (file:///Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/static/index.js:67:9)
", source: /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/initialize-test-window.js (105)
```

This error shows up in my older installation, but I have remove atom and all files related to him:

```
rm -rf ~/.atom
rm -rf /usr/local/bin/atom
rm -rf /usr/local/bin/apm
rm -rf /Applications/Atom.app
rm -rf ~/Library/Preferences/com.github.atom.plist
rm -rf "~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt"
rm -rf "~/Library/Application Support/Atom"
rm -rf "~/Library/Saved Application State/com.github.atom.savedState"
rm -rf ~/Library/Caches/com.github.atom
rm -rf ~/Library/Caches/Atom
```

I dont have now any project history or external plugins and error still occurs. 

### Versions

Atom: 1.18.0
OS: macOS Sierra

data.title: Atom doesn't correctly indent lines with combining diacritics
data.body: ### Prerequisites * [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description [Description of the issue] ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Paste the following text into a new plain text tab. ``` x = 1 γ = 1 φ̄ = 1 ``` **Expected behavior:** All three `= 1` should be indented to the same distance. **Actual behavior:** The third line doesn't indent fully: **Reproduces how often:** Always. ### Versions ``` Atom : 1.18.0 Electron: 1.3.15 Chrome : 52.0.2743.82 Node : 6.5.0 ``` ### Additional Information Tested on macOS 10.12.5.

data.title: Switch to micromatch for performance?
data.body:
Since [minimatch is currently a dependency](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/d9ebd7e125d5f07def1a057a0a8278d4d9d7d23a/package.json#L46), why not switch to _[micromatch]_? See [_Why use micromatch?_][micromatch]…

I think it’s a drop-in replacement, so should be an easy [if small] win?

[micromatch]: https://npmjs.com/package/micromatch#why-use-micromatch

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: editor.selectAll is not a function
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce:]

new command in init.coffee:
atom.commands.add 'atom-text-editor', 'editor:auto-indent-all', ->
	console.log "working"
	editor = atom.views.getView(atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor())
	return unless editor
	editor.selectAll()
	editor.autoIndentSelectedRows()
	editor.clear(true)
